body.p: “I was surprised to hear that their lobster-traps [image] were made in Vermont “,” costing something over a dollar apiece “,”—much timber “,”—but it seems they can be made cheaper there and sent down by railroad.”
PE 12, pg. 418 / 2 April-31 July 1857/ NNPM MA 1302:29 / T vol. # XXIII / PDF # XV / JIX
